member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.GetRangedRowValue(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Generates a random email address that is greater than the value of and lower than the value of .
member.param: The exclusive lower bound of the random object returned.
The exclusive upper bound of the random object returned.
An array of values that cannot be returned by the provider.
member.returns: A random instance of greater than and less than .
member.exception: Thrown because the generation of ranged street names is not supported.

member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.GetRowValue(Falsus.DataGeneratorContext,Falsus.GeneratorProperties.WeightedRange{System.String}[],System.String[])
member.summary: Generates a random email address based on the context and excluded ranges.
member.param: An instance of defining the current generation context.
An array of s defining the ranges that cannot be returned by the provider.
An array of values that cannot be returned by the provider.
member.returns: A random instance of that is outside of the specified .
member.exception: Thrown because the generation of ranged email addresses is not supported.

member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.GetRowValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a value based on the provided .
member.param: An unique identifier for the object.
member.returns: A value with the specified unique identifier.
member.remarks: Since both the and returning type are this method returns exactly what is passed on the argument.

member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.GetRowValue(Falsus.DataGeneratorContext,System.String[])
member.summary: Generates a random street name based on the context and excluded objects.
member.param: An instance of defining the current generation context.
An array of values that cannot be returned by the provider.
member.remarks: The generated email address will result from the concatenation of the argument values (seperated by a dot) along with a randomly chosen domain from the list. If nothing is provided as the value, a random string will be generated. If the contains the value that was generated then a number will be appended at end (eg. if john.doe@domain.com is present then it will become john.doe2@domain.com).

member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.GetValueId(System.String)
member.summary: Gets a unique identifier for the provided .
member.param: The value.
member.returns: A containing the unique identifier of the provided value.
member.remarks: Since both the and returning type are this method returns exactly what is passed on the argument.

member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.Load(Falsus.GeneratorProperties.DataGeneratorProperty{System.String},System.Int32)
member.summary: Instructs the data provider to prepare the data for generation based on the provided .
member.param: An implementation of the generic defining the property that this provider has been attached to.
The desired number of rows to be generated.
member.remarks: Invoked before any calculation takes place, the goal of this method is usually preparing or caching data for the generation taking place afterwards.

member.name: M:Falsus.Providers.Internet.EmailProvider.GetDomain
member.summary: Gets a random domain from the list.
member.remarks: If has only one item then this method will always return the same value.

member.name: T:Falsus.Providers.Internet.MimeTypeProviderConfiguration
member.summary: This class represents the configuration object of the data provider.

member.name: P:Falsus.Providers.Internet.MimeTypeProviderConfiguration.IncludeDeprecated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not deprecated MIME types should be considered for random value generation.
member.value: True if deprecated MIME types should be included, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Falsus.Providers.Internet.MimeTypeProviderConfiguration.ExcludeUncommon
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not uncommon MIME types should be excluded from the random value generation.
member.value: True if uncommon MIME types should be excluded, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Falsus.Providers.Internet.MimeTypeProviderConfiguration.TreatAliasesAsUnique
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not MIME type aliases should be considered as unique.
member.value: True if aliases should be considered unique, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Settings this value to true will cause, for example, application/javascript and text/javascript to be treated as two different MIME types.
